intro: Tournefortia blanchetii, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in coastal areas and has smooth, waxy leaves. Tournefortia blanchetii is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
